Then there are plot holes that go unexplained, miracles that inexplicably happen just in time to avert death, and at one point the characters do something incredibly stupid and moronic that would have killed them all, but the scene just suddenly ends and skips to the next day where they are all fine without a scratch, yet offers no explanation as to how this happened...wtf?! However, the worst of it all is the way the actual final battle goes and how they defeat the villain, because it was almost unbelievable. It was like comedy, as if that whole sequence was a prank and Ashton Kutcher was going to come on screen and tell us we were punked. The movie was also a giant advertisement for Krispy Kreme.3. Subpar Acting/Script - the characters are bland and just not good at acting, with maybe the slight exception of the blue and yellow rangers who seemed to actually put forth some effort into their performances. Granted, the script was ridiculous to begin with. Things became predictable, you already knew what they were going to say or do before it happened because we have seen it all before -it was all unoriginal. All the clichés were used in this movie. All the characters had the usual "life struggles", though most of those "struggles" were so shallow and superficial, that they couldn't be considered struggles to begin with... so feeling any connection to them was impossible. The craziest part is that it appears that this movie was made to be watched by middle school aged children, yet the movie goes out of its way to repeatedly show us how the characters are ultra-cool and unique, and are fearless, unruly rebels who commit crimes and break the law over and over. They cuss throughout, they drink underage, they say lame one liners and try to act so hard. Still, though, they are unimpressive and end up being annoying.. like we get it, you're 16 and you are top dog bad asses in your small town.. now let's move on.The only reason I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is because it's not the WORST movie I've ever seen, but it still sucks pretty bad.

Growing up and loving the cheesiness of the original series, I went into this film with an open mind. Needless to say, my mind was blown away. It's perfect! And yes, it is an origin story which means that it focuses on the characters and developing their relationships with one another. The morphing sequence towards the end of the movie was a perfect payoff to a wonderfully timed story. I really hope we get to see a sequel, if not several sequels. As far as i'm concerned, this movie was a hit for me. More, please!

I liked it.My biggest mistake was reading the reviews first. They killed the hype I had when I first saw the trailer.I don't consider myself a fan of power rangers, but i'm familiar with the show from back when I was younger.In that perspective I can tell you that I loved the movie.I liked the actors, I liked how they all had their own backstories, and how they connected as a Team.For me the best review that was made about this movie was from Brian Cranston himself, back when this movie was announced, and now I can tell he was 100% correct.To summarise. People who love boring movies will hate this movie.

Review title: Brilliant modern take on the classic!
Review_body: So, being a Power Rangers fan I went to watch this movie with my friend who also is a huge fan of the franchise. Honestly weren't expecting much from the movie but only the first scene was enough to glue us to our seats, ZORDON (Red Ranger) v RITA (Green Ranger), what else do you need!! The 5 actors were phenomenal especially Darce, Becky G, Naomi Scott and RJ Cyler, well RJ Cyler was outstanding. The character development was amazing, which we never got to see in the 1993 series. All the rangers had a strong emotional back story which quickly attaches you to them. The only weak part of the movie was the ending which I think was too rushed but it too had it's charm (the morphing, Zords and the MEGA ZORD). It's a must watch for all the fans and those who aren't fans can also give it a shot. Definitely gonna watch it again and can't wait for the sequel!

Review title: A New-Nostalgia Blast from the Pa....Future
Review_body: It's Morphin Time! At least that's the case for superhero movies as this particular flick surpassed every expectation i had (and believe me, they were high.) Not to give away anything about the plot, we get some much desired backstory to the delight of Fans and new comers everywhere.With the new rebooted feel, but keeping true to the classic cheesiness of the 90's this is a combo unlike any other i've seen before. Familiar characters, names, zords and colors bring back a joy (movie wise) in which i haven't experienced since the warehouse scene in Batman vs Superman (BATMAN RULES!!!).Now with the name "Power Rangers" you don't expect a whole lot when it comes to characterization, but in a mind blowing fashion this turns out to be one of the best characterized movies in the past few years. They create and bring to life lovable characters, including the most lovable character in recent memory, The Blue Ranger Billy.You may be wondering about the action and believe me, it doesn't disappoint. Hand to hand combat that would make some kung fu movies blush, complete with clashing of Giant mechanical dinos and even some exploding puddies (watch to figure out that word if you don't know what i'm talking about)It is a constant change from slow to fast paced, in a way that is completely tolerable and constantly engages you in ways that keep you captivated by this amazing, yet simple, plot. Not only is it a must see for Power Rangers fans, but Super Hero movie enthusiasts everywhere! It is in my top 3 superhero movies of all time. No joke.I grade this movie an EASY A+, and with my fan boy adrenaline pulsing am tempted to give it an extra "+" But one thing is for certain, as soon as this movie comes out, it will takes its place on my shelf along with all of my other favorite movies. You can be assured that if there is a special edition, that i will be purchasing it.Rating: A+

Review title: A great Power Rangers movie, but maybe not a solid film.
Review_body: It's hard to screw up the Power Rangers when the original series embraced its campy origins in Super Sentai. This film takes itself as both a serious reboot with a lot of underlying cheesiness. Some welcome inclusions widen the Power Rangers typical story line of acceptance to relevant themes in our current generation. The first act starts off really strong, seeing a darker-tone set up our cast of heroes. The second act starts to dwindle off and waste time before finally revealing each heroes' backstory and making them bond together. The third act is (unfortunately) rushed but still an entertaining and satisfying final fight. If only the film shortened the second act and lengthened the third would it have solidified its existence as a strong film. Sadly its flaws detract from it becoming a relevant movie in the year 2017, but it will make history with the first gay superhero and the (first?) autistic superhero as well. As a Power Rangers entry though, oh boy, is it exciting. Far better than the other Ranger's entries into film. Sadly, the one crucial element to nostalgia — the theme song — is clipped to FIVE seconds in length. If it had been spread throughout the final fight it could have fully embraced its origins.

Review title: Too all you haters out there , calm down and i know you could not make a better movie
Review_body: This movie deserves a sequel , Its a movie that people can relate to on a whole new level . I liked how the director made it that way to make it more enjoyable . To all you haters , maybe next time don't watch it . Best Cast , so no reboot because i am not going to support it. Plz give us a sequel , there is a huge fan base !!!

Review title: Better than it had the right to be
Review_body: This movie was what I thought I was watching as a kid. The action and in-jokes were great and fun, but the character development was excellent with good effects to back them. Fantastic new direction for the property. Underrated movie. Eat your heart out Transphormers

Yes. I've been waiting this remake movie ever since the studio of Lionsgate announced to produce this movie. Finally, I've done watching it. And yes, I love it so much. However, I still feel a little bit disappointed of one scene in this movie. I can't tell which scene, cause I hate to be a spoiler. Just hope that there will be a sequel and tell more about that scene and what exactly happen to them. (If you already watch it, you be able to know which scene did I mean it).Overall, I super love this remake. The way it create of robots fighting with huge monster makes me want to cry... I've been grown by watching Power Rangers. And I can't believe, I am older now and if I'm married, I am proud to bring my child to watch this movie.Thank you Lionsgate for make this as a real.8 out of 10 from my review.Go ahead. Watch this movie and just remember this is your very best childhood memoir.

Before reading there may be small spoiler ...I was a fan of the series for years, and I still find the best the first generation, for this movie I was very anxious, and now that I saw it, I can say that I do not exceed my expectations, the action scenes a bit slow, very Melosa the movie at times, and frankly hoped a bit more cliché, but in short you have to talk about the good thing now, the soundtrack pretty good, in fact the listen although for a few seconds that classic electric guitar of the 90 I get excited , Effects and designs of suits and zord very good except for the megazord, and it is necessary to emphasize something, that is the suspense, they play with the fan that knows by memory that will happen but they play with it when, despite everything a promising start I hope there is A sequel since there were things pending, here is a diamond in the rough, maybe with a better creative team can get a good saga, maybe it will not be at the level of matrix, godfather, Lord of the rings, but if you can Be better than the saga of Transformers and harry potter.traslated from Spanish with google

Daughter was a huge Power Rangers fan as a child, so we took my granddaughter to see the movie. Loved it and would give 10 stars, but we were shocked at the language. The original was campy and cheesy, but clean fun for kids. This movie tried to show the kids were tough and edgy before they became Power Rangers by having them swear regularly. No need. Clearly they are setting up for a sequel. Hope they eliminate the bad language next time.

Review title: New spin on an old classic
Review_body: I personally loved it, I don't see why people are giving it a bad review

Review title: Please go watch this movie and decided whether you like it for yourself!
Review_body: I absolutely adored this movie! I want to the movie theater and couldn't stop smiling the entire time! The diversity and backstory, each character felt like they were great separately and then perfect together. I loved the way RJ Cyler handled Billy's character and it really reminded me of some of my autistic friends in high school. Each character has struggles and it really feels as if you are connecting with the cast.Yeah, it might not be a kid movie, but neither is the avengers and people still take their kids to see that. There are some jokes that might be a little crude but it's entertaining. Please go watch this movie and decided whether you like it for yourself!

Loved it! Great fun for family and kids. Contains quite a few references to the TV shows and comics. Really well executed for what it wants to be. RJ Cyler (Billy, the Blue Ranger) gives a great performance that steals the show for me. However its a movie that most of critics wont enjoy, because its not made for their demographic, unlike many others in the same category. Its a movie made for fans of the show and also to a younger audience, with details that maybe wont reach the older audience or non-fans. Overall, it is really worth checking it out for what it is!

Great movie! Most people giving it bad reviews are those who have disdain for younger audiences or that just wanted an Transformes/Avengers-like movie with only fighting and no character development. I was amazed at how good the movie was, given I've read some reviews previous to go watching it. It is pretty solid, self-contained and with some references for hardcore fans to get. The focus of the movie is the kids and not their powers or shooting lasers and fighting for half of the movie. Unlike many of the same genre, it actually have proper character development and show us believable emotions. Great movie, overall.

This reboot is by far one of the worst I have seen. I grew up in the 90s and my love for power Rangers was dear. If you are an original fan please DO NOT watch. The film was sexualized and at times a little disturbing. This remake is for a whole new generation. If this is what we are producing for the next generation then this is unsettling. The audience In the movie seemed to enjoy this movie but as an original fan I had to walk out half way. The actors performed more on a chessy, no acting skills level. The villain was a tormented individual with no talent. Zordon was completely different, more of an aggressive angry frustrated personality. That alone made me walk out, original Zordon was patient, wise, and kind. I believe we got 15 minutes of fighting if that in this 2 hour movie. Everything that was once positive about the series, was completely missing in the movie. Sad to say, the new Power Rangers movie was a disaster.

Review title: Not a bad movie but could of had more battles.
Review_body: Saw the Power Rangers,i loved the special effects but 1/4 or the movie was them finding the crystals and finding out the were power rangers.2/3's of the movie was more about their personnel lives and about the last 20 minutes or so is the actual battle.My grandsons were bored except for the last 20 minutes and they are huge power ranger fans.Most of the younger children in the theater were bored too.

As good as you thought it would be! I think the most impressive part of this film is how in parts in it is very dark while keeping the same nostalgic feel of the original, Elisabeth Banks reimagine's Rita repulsa to be a violent and cold blooded villain while the rangers themselves throw themselves at being heroes while dealing with everyday problems that teenagers have growing up. Go and watch this film, easily one of the best of 2017 and one that is certainly more for adults who were kids 20 years ago when the ranger arrived!

Terrible script & story. Knew it from the trailers, but still had the balls to watch it... Came with minimal expectations but was STILL DISAPPOINTED. This is soo cringy in an awful way. It is not that cringy and corny type that'll make you laugh because of how awful it is. It is just plain sad, awful, and painful to watch. THIS IS THE ONLY SECOND TIME WE WALKED OUT OF THE CINEMA IN THE MIDDLE OF THE MOVIE. (FYI, FIRST TIME WAS INSURGENT 2015)

I remember when I was 5, how nothing could stop me waiting in front of the telly for the Power Rangers every Saturday. Sure now they were just some asses in tights, but back then if you can't do those poses they do you'll be teased by other kids. It's good to see this back on theaters, good to hear the classic music, and it's definitely surprised to see the old pink and green rangers.(The new pink ranger is very pretty btw) And... that's it.Unfortunately I can't say this is a good, new version, and it's barely a good film. And I don't understand why it's PG-13? It's pretty much like "Fantastic Four(2005)" which is rated G.Anyway... I won't say it is good, but nor bad. I do appreciate it for bringing back those memories. To the 80's.

I grew up watching the power rangers. From the very first movie, the subsequent sequels, spin-offs and even the various stand a lone series, from dino thunder to spd and the like. i went into this movie expecting at least some level of campyness or "the cheese" as i call it. But there was almost none to be found. You would think that it Would have at least a few nods to the original movie or at least poke some fun at it, what you get instead is 1.5+ hour joyless ride that is too serious for its own good. In a world filled with superhero movies this one tries its very least to differentiate from the competition. All the elements are there, but it seemed rushed and ultimately disingenuous.

Review title: Don't have your hopes too high
Review_body: The first installment of the Power Rangers series, was very well done. The movie was mostly back story and character development, which did make some fans upset with the movie, but there are five sequels planned. So have faith.I only noticed a few problems right off the bat, but otherwise the movie was just fine and enjoyable for an entire family to see. It had it's childish aspects, with childish humor at many points, but it also had a dark side to it. It had a deep meaning to many parts, such as Zach's mother being sick which you learn quickly on through the movie. As I stated, there was a lot of childish humor, but even adults can enjoy some of it. Such as one of Jason's friends attempting to milk a male cow, not realizing that it was male. Or the nick name that students gave to Billie when he was a child, I'll let you watch to see that. Even at those points, they're enjoyable for everyone(unless you don't have any sense of humor).This installment was completely opposite of what the T.V. shows and old movies used to be, as it was more realistic, less cheesy, and much more dark.Rita was vicious in this movie as she hunted for gold so she could build Goldar, and there are many jump scares that come with her. There's no doubt in my mind that a child would truly be afraid of her. Even with Rita and all, every character has a deeper side and they can connect quite well. Like in this installment, Billie has a form of autism, and Trini is a lesbian. They explore these, and show how people think of them because of it. There were only a couple of cheesy moments, such as Jason giving the classic line, "it's morphing time" but how could he not say it. Then there was the classic song that had to be included, "Go! Go! Power Rangers!" It had a beautiful nostalgic feel to it that made every fan of the shows sit up happily. Otherwise there were situations like the Zeo crystal being under Krispy Kreme and the metaphor of it representing life of America, and Rita eating a doughnut while everyone else fights. Even then it made me laugh at the pure silliness of it.The CGI in the movie was absolutely beautiful, with Goldar looking like a monster. Even the Mecca Zord (not a spoiler, look at the trailer) looked amazing. The action scenes were very good, even if there weren't many of them. It was fast paced, but had slow motion moments to show how powerful they were hitting, they added in CGI when Rita hit very hard just to show the true impact. The fight scenes were funny at some points, and very fluent. They were rather easy to keep track of.There were many moments that drew out emotions, such as Rita being good at drawing out fear, and the movie might even make you tear up at some points. It did a very good job at making you connect with the characters and really feel for them.I think that Power Rangers did an amazing job with it's camera angles, and having the idea of "showing, not telling." There was lot of exposition as the characters got to know one another, but all the other information was set up in showing us what happens. There weren't too many problems with Power Rangers, but some people didn't like the camera angles they used which I personally enjoyed. It was something new and fresh, and reminded me of someone following them with a camera at some points. The acting was off at some points with a couple lines being delivered weirdly.I don't blame the actors all too much, because I believe they're all relatively new and they're young. Besides a couple lines being off and facial expressions, the acting was done very well for children their age.Some people didn't like the fact that the Ranger suits formed toff so it would show their faces. It did kind of upset me, as we don't get to see much of the suits through the movie, but it helped the audience connect as the suits didn't have moving mouths since they aren't CGI.As i stated earlier, we don't get to see much of the Rangers themselves but that will come soon enough. The action was very good for the time it had, and we should appreciate that.The movie did feel rushed and hard to keep track of at points, such as the beginning when they introduce Jason. It's very fast paced, but after that scene it slowed down and really introduced them. Then the only other scene that was hard to keep track of was when Zordon woke up.I thought that Power Rangers was very good, and was much better than i had excepted because i didn't expect much. So if you're going to go see it, I recommend not getting your hopes up because it's not a block buster. But it's definitely a must see.

Review title: This is not a good movie (SPOILERS)
Review_body: This movie is boring, poorly written, and stupid. It's not stupid in a fun way, either. I went into this movie with expectations that I would have for a Transformers movie; I hoped for explosions, fun action scenes, and cool CGI. Guess what this movie had? NONE OF THAT. Because it was so boring, I was forced to sit through boring scenes of people talking about boring back stories.This movie suffered from the same problems that Superman v Batman and Suicide Squad suffered from: they tried so hard to fit so much stuff in, that the pacing is terrible and nothing feels like it goes together. The whole movie is very forgettable except one scene... (Spoilers, kinda)The opening scene, when the Red Ranger (who's character name I can't remember and can't be bothered to go back and look) gets into a car chase with the police after pulling a prank at the high school. The cinematography and camera-work is fantastic and really got my hopes very high for the rest of the movie. It's reminiscent of the tank scene from Dawn of the Planet of the Apes. It's a little difficult to pay attention to everything that's going on, but at least it looks cool and keeps you engaged, UNLIKE THE REST OF THE MOVIE. Overall, I would say that no matter what reviews people read, they're going to see it no matter what. Also, (spoilers again) when they finally morph into the animal robots (I never watched the show much, so maybe I just don't get it) they play the original theme song from the show for no reason other than to force nostalgia. At least the original show, from what I did see, was campy and fun. This movie can't decide if it wants to be serious or funny (just like Suicide Squad). Come to think of it, this movie has a lot of similarities to Suicide Squad, except with Suicide Squad, it had more than THREE ACTION SCENES IN THE WHOLE MOVIE. This is a bad movie. Go see it.

Review title: Thank you Van Der Beek & whoever led to this being made with that 15 minute short a while back.
Review_body: Okay, I watched the 15 minute short a while back with the gritty 'Rangers' it was everything people who grew up watching the Power Rangers series wished it had become but they stamped it out instantly and you couldn't see it online anywhere. Thankfully that set the wheels in motion, while it was still hot, to throw a Power Rangers movie out, I saw the teaser and I couldn't believe how much it excited me. Then again, the Fantastic Four reboot did that same thing via a well put together trailer. Then I watched it.The actors (especially the actor playing Rita, I forget her name) were brilliant. The character's private life outside of school had me filling up a few times, each different and enough to make me sympathise with them and wish they'd become this group of Rangers. It was surprisingly funny, cheesy as well at times but I think it was very much intended. ..Just a tip of the hat to the original TV series.It had it all, I nearly cried, I laughed, it was cheesy when it shouldn't have been which had me linking it back to 'the good ol' days'. Action packed, not enough to bore me like anything Bay related but enough to keep me zoned in. I hope to god this makes enough because I want to see a second, I really do. This was everything I had hoped, just the image of thinking in 1990+ 'what would a Power Rangers movie look like in 2017' - Exactly that, and then some.

Review title: Not as bad as everyone says
Review_body: People giving it 1 star must not remember the original series... And how over the top the action scenes were and how cheesy the dialog was. The movie was like one long episode, sure things were a bit different than the original series, but come on it's been 20 years since the good version was on TV. It started off really slow and some scenes felt unnecessary in character building. The message of the importance of teamwork came across loud and clear; 5 misfit kids, each with their own issues coming together to help each other when they need each other the most. Overall it was a modern take on the original and an entertaining way to spend 2hrs.. And it had a pretty good soundtrack too!

This wasn't supposed to happen, things weren't supposed to be this way. This movie was supposed to suck, my childhood dreams were supposed to stay childhood dreams. When I found out they were making an adult power rangers movie, I knew that it would suck but I would still see it because I spent countless dollars and hours on power rangers when I was a kid. But this movie pulled the biggest surprise since the Patriots beating the Falcons in the super bowl. Not only was this movie good, but it was fantastic! I actually got really nervous when I was about to see it because I was afraid it wouldn't do my childhood justice. I didn't actually think it was possible to make a power rangers movie that was this good! The casting in this movie was absolutely spot on. I didn't know any of the 5 people they picked to be the rangers, it worried me but they all were SO GOOD! They did all of there characters so much justice. Bryan Cranston and Bill Hader absolutely hit it out of the park with Zordon and Alpha 5. I've heard some people saying they weren't a fan of Elizabeth Banks as Rita Repulsa but I have to whole heartedly disagree, I thought she did a great job of bringing Rita to a modern day film but still giving her that great sense of nostalgia. This movie is a little dark at some points, but it isn't a depressing movie to watch. It has a lot of humor and goofiness that will make you reminiscence of your old days of watching power rangers. This movie was also surprising in the aspect that it has a lot of curve balls and surprises. They would have a lot of parts where they would make you think they were about to have a very cliché movie scene. But then they would completely take you in another direction. There is also a nice little mid credit scene so stay tuned for that. This movie felt a lot like if you take the good things that Marvel does with there movies, and the good thing DC comics does with there movies, and used those aspects to make a power rangers movie, this would be the result. If you were a fan of power rangers, you'll love this. If you weren't, I still think you would have a good time with this movie. My favorite movie of this year or last year!!!

Review title: A great deal of depth, very refreshing
Review_body: Questions centered on CGI, special effects or the tech used in the film can be quickly answered with 'yes, yes, they are done well,' and 'oh, you will have an enjoyable ride, particularly in the third act, or the final 40 minutes,' and yet, people who go to see Power Rangers again may be doing it for more than just the armor and the zords. For once in a twenty-year-long (and expensive) barrage of costumed-hero trilogies, alliances and big versus-showdowns, we finally have a breather in something that is really quite serious, quite grown-up, and nowhere near childish.Power Rangers points the camera at people, and admittedly, holds it there for a somewhat protracted period of time, but much good comes from it. Before this film, you will never imagine being privileged with the opportunity to actually feel for a Power Ranger character on a deep, existential level. These people begin to matter to you very quickly, and at no time during the movie are you made to feel that their stories are a receding tide written to be gotten over with – obligatory backstories conveniently swept away so that action can commence. Power Rangers has come into a league of its own, and the broad majority of entrants in the superhero genre will struggle to even remotely compare.Comparisons will be made by some with the Warner Bros. picture that emerged several years ago – Pacific Rim – but there are important differences between the two movies. Pacific Rim is a robot movie oriented on giant monsters, with personal stories enmeshed in the script to serve as girding for a loud action movie. What Power Rangers has pulled off – and this is very surprising to say of a Power Rangers movie – is a coming-of-age introspective, almost art-house-y piece of youth literature cataloging the stories of young people who face dark prospects in their own lives, but happen to come across robots and giant monsters. The literary direction of the Power Rangers movie is extraordinary, given how the formulaic comfort of hi-tech action over character development seems to be the go-to for much of the superhero fare churned out in recent years.Watching Pacific Rim, or any Avenger movie, always feels like guilty pleasure, and we always stop short of feeling too much for the characters, because the characters are not well-built anyway and there is always this detachment we sense – this disconnect that these characters carry about themselves that set them apart from reality. Throughout a lot of the modern superhero clash-and-bang we treat ourselves to, we retain a helicopter enjoyment of such characters, watching them move as pawns across the chessboard. The worlds in which they operate are quite independent of our own, even if locations familiar to us are used. This is not to say that there is no merit to such movies. Rather, they make up the bulk of what we have grown used to, and in the void hence, Power Rangers has managed to bring us a new way of stringing together a superhero movie.Power Rangers fills an important gap – the wish for characters that, outside their powers, resonate in empathic symphony with our own challenges, aspirations and fears, and when in their powers, retain a discernible humanity. The individual is not subsumed by the superhero power; the Ranger identity does not take over and does not render the person the mere flesh that lives underneath the garb. Even better, the Ranger power is not even an extension of the individual – as though the young adult him/herself wasn't enough and had to be given upgrades. It feels strange that we now look to a Power Rangers movie to remind ourselves that we do not have to become someone/something else in order to come into our own. To become powerful, we do not need to shed ourselves. Rather, we need to know ourselves, be ourselves and use that to our advantage. And when you rise powerful and confident, your self isn't eradicated. You are not lost. Those Ranger powers come from within these young people, and the gemstones they found were no more than conduits.The sense of ownership of power that this film conveys is radical in the industry of story development today. Power Rangers refrains from aggrandizing the role the machines have, or the fact that there is an otherworldly spacecraft, or the place the suits have in making the young men and women ready for combat. Like we said, the camera's eye stays on these troubled, unique individuals, and they are allowed to define the story and carry it all the way to the finish line. Indeed, the technological implements that occur in the film are treated so matter-of-factly, that they melt into the background of the narrative and become united into the fabric of the story itself: you are being given a chance to break out of debilitating despair – are you going to make good of it?Power Rangers is a movie that lets you keep all of the film and have nothing to be ashamed of. Pick a T-shirt or an artefact attributable to any other superhero/giant robot movie, and you may find yourself wincing at the elements of hilarity that stick around and haunt that T-shirt, weapon or figurine. Power Rangers in its 2017 movie composure is a success for having ripped its way out of this paradigm to transcend it; and now, anything related to this movie comes with a tinge of forlornness borne of real struggles we can identify with. That such maturity arrives in our time on the saddle of a Power Rangers movie is astonishing in itself without thought for what other franchises should have done. And when you do think about the deluge of action vomit that has ruined the dignity of film in the last decade or two, you will find these Power Rangers to be a hearty godsend.

Review title: Developed characters taking on social stigmas while also banishing evil on the side.
Review_body: Leadership. Teamwork. Friendship. Good vs evil. Surface level themes. Power Rangers is a movie about being honest with oneself and others, accepting your own flaws, and taking responsibility for your actions. The spectrum. The importance of communication (especially within the family unit). The value of kindness to strangers. The weight of familial responsibility. Gender equality. Selflessness. While the movie does not fully address these issues, it does shed some light on them, and given proper space for open dialogue, you can push those discussions further. Power Rangers shows the audience that it is okay to be human; that it is okay to make mistakes; that atonement is possible, if you learn to not only forgive yourself, but to also believe in who you can become.This movie let's the moment breathe, and allows characters to develop, revealing pieces of themselves to each other and to the audience, so that you, as the viewer, are a part of the bonding process. There is a bit of you in every character: the unfulfilled potential, the regret of an action, the feeling of being misunderstood, the view from the outside looking in, the anger from feeling helpless, the want of something better, the unrelenting goal-oriented fervor, etc. Plus, (minor spoiler) the opening car chase sequence was totes awesome.

I loved this movie so much!! Been waiting for something like this for over 12 years! Amazing can't recommend this ENOUGH! Would recommend any person to see this movie. Amazing Stunning IDK Amazing? oh, wait :). 10/10 would recommend you watch this with anyone. Probably one of the best movies that i have ever watched in my whole life. Amazing picture would recommend to see it.

Review title: Power Rangers Movie Review: It's Morphin Time
Review_body: Saul Alfaro English 121 Dr. MillsIt's Morphin Time (Power Rangers Movie Review)Without any hope for this movie to be critically successful even for the long time fans, Power Rangers is a pleasant surprise. Before the movie began, I had in mind what the majority of people thought before it was released. This movie was not only suppose to be bad but terrible, but as I like to do with every movie I see, I go in with an open mind regardless of anyone's expectations including my own. I really liked Power Rangers because I thought the movie was very well character driven and not heavily reliant on the Power Rangers brand or name in any way and expecting people to enjoy this movie simply because of that. This is key because all of these characters do not "morph" until later in the third act of the movie. The climax of the third act was very powerful because the Power Rangers are finally ready to morph after all of their hard work and training. I am also sure that all of the long time Power Rangers fans also got a little misty eyed when the colorfully yet realistic battle Armour covers up them all up and officially become Power Rangers as Brian Cranston's character Mordon says the iconic words every Power Rangers fan will know "It's morphin time." In the third act the Power Rangers gore is felt with the main villain and antagonist Rita striking fear into the new Power Rangers by uttering the words "I've killed Rangers before!" The third and final act of the movie truly does feel earned by fleshing out all of the characters and building them up from the start which in my eyes made the movie work in the end. Power Rangers was a pleasant surprise because just like the vast majority of people I expected a bomb but I will give Power Rangers three stars out of five.

Honestly the best movie I have seen in a while ♥ if i could give more than 10 stars, I would! The fight scenes, soundtrack, cast & animation are really fantastic! Black Ranger (Ludi Lin) is a total babe, and Becky G (Yellow Ranger) really surprised me. She's not only a singer, but an actress as well!

I can see where they tried to make it similar, but different. However, I have not seen a movie this bad since the 3rd Spiderman Movie and Avatar The Last Air Bender live action that no one speaks of. Now I can't say its the worst cause I have seen worse, but its not worth the time to even watch it let alone pay to see in any theater. If you want something that is power rangers and okay, watch the original. The only things honestly good about the movie were their progressive inclusion of a LGBT and a young man on the Autistic spectrum. Thing is having these things does not make a movie good and though they are trying to keep their characters and ideas up today with changing culture. The movie concept was outdated to say the least and has been way overdone not just by every single series of the power rangers, but also every hero/action movie made since the 1990s. Stay at home, don't waist your money. Go watch Beauty and the Beast if anything.

Review title: OK. But cld of been better
Review_body: As my summary says. It could off been better. I am a big fan off the original power rangers and I so wanted this to be great. Sadly it was just OK. Not enough fighting in this. We all know the original cast were great martial artists. But after watching this film. I can't tell you if any of the cast can do martial arts. Story was OK. Just took ages to get to it. Was not impressed with zordon. Feel the casting was wrong. The one who stood out for me was R J who played the blue ranger. He was great. One last thing I was disappointed with is the fact there's no ... morphine time and the rangers holding the morphers.For the next one of like to see Jason Frank as a ranger. Make sure you stay for the bits after the credits.

This movie is incredible! It starts as Lord of the Rings and it ends as Marvel's Avengers. It's real: the main teenager characters are real, with real problems; it shows the first LGBT and autistic heroes. Producers did the best bringing Power Rangers to big screen again, making the movie more dark, more realistic, more authentic. The direction, set design, photography, the cast and the script are memorable. Don't be bias by "Power Rangers" title thinking about a kids-oriented movie: this film is absolutely suggested to all the lovers of science fiction, adventure and special effects looking spectacular.

skip to 1:30:00, then its ,....mehthe cast is bad the plot is meh the cg is good the fights are...not bad they try to be funny,...they fail.they should understand that we don't watch this kind of movies to learn about childhood of a no name actress now as pink or yellow or whatever. having to wait 90 minutes to see some power ranger actions is just not right.

Review title: If you like the original, you'll love this!
Review_body: This movie exceeded all of my expectations! Always had been a fan of the original show and this movie perfectly re-introduces the franchise to a new generation. The movie felt like it was aimed towards millennials (since the fans of the original were born when the show debuted). I love how the producers wanted to focus on the characters and human aspect of the Power Rangers. The characters were very well developed and the actors had extreme chemistry with each other. I love movies where the viewers become invested into the characters and the story takes time to tell the stories of the characters. This movie isn't without flaws. It takes the same approach as Edwards did with Godzilla in 2014: the movie is called Power Rangers but said Power Rangers are not in the film for a long time and only appear in the climax. Some of the dialogue is cheesy but what can you expect for a Power Rangers movie! There were a few scenes where "the feels" really hit, and if a movie does that, then the movie did its job. I was expecting a Transformers ripoff but this movie is far superior than the Transformers movies (sorry Michael). I recommend this movie to everyone, Power Ranger fan or not!

Review title: Great film, everything I expected of a Power Rangers origin story
Review_body: Great movie to hopefully make the francise kick off again! Some tacky and corner stuff, but that's exactly what I expected! Lots of funny bits! Hopefully more action in a sequel! Only thing for me, I would of liked to see the zords actually transform! (Money saving i guess)Overall any Power Rangers fan would be happy with this

This Is My First Ever Review On IMDb, The Movie Is So Amazing Reminds Me Of My Childhood With Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, WWE(The Old School Days), Bob The Builder, Sonic The Hedgehog, Super Mario, Toy Story, PIXAR, Disney, Dreamworks And Many More, This Is A Fantastic Move To Watch, Jason Lee Scott The Red Tyrannosaurus Ranger, Billy Cranston The Blue Triceratops Ranger, Zack Taylor The Black Mastodon Ranger, Kimberly Ann Hart The Pink Pterodactyl Ranger And Trini Kwan The Yellow Saber Tooth Tiger Ranger Are The Legendary Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, They Are Heroes And Amazing Fighters, The Scenes In The Movie Is Amazing All Of Them, I Liked Jasons Personality Best In The Movie, Zordon And Alpha 5 Fixed The Morphin Grid To Make The 5 Chosen Fighters As Power Rangers, Rita Repulsa Creates Goldar And Makes Goldar Big, Its Morphin Time This Movie Is Cool, Mastodon, Pterodactyl, Triceratops, Saber Tooth Tiger, Tyrannosaurus, All The Dinozords Become The Incredible Mighty Dino Megazord, The Acting, Music And Scenes Are All Fantastic In This Cool Film, Can't Wait To See Tommy Oliver In The Second Reboot Movie

I watched the movie a few days ago and enjoyed it a lot! It took me on an emotional roller coaster, made me love, cry and sit on the edge of my seat. I grew up watching Power Rangers (not the original but the following series on nickelodeon) and this movie had everything that made me love the show when I was a kid. But my personal Highlight was the movies diversity of characters (spoiler ahead): Almost all the Teenager had different ethnicities and backgrounds, one of the girls was struggling with her sexuality, one boy was autistic. It's so important for children to see heroes they can identify with and Power Rangers did a great job providing these.

My husband and I took our daughters to watch this movie. We all absolutely loved it. You can't go in expecting everything to be like the original Power Rangers. We all enjoyed the movie. My 13 year old daughter said it was one of the best movies she has seen and I enjoyed seeing her getting into the scenes. I would highly recommend this movie.

I'm tired of watching movies that are not accuarte to the originals. I loved the power rangers as a kid, but of course to appeal to the 2017 - 2018 crowd watching this movie they had to make the yellow ranger gay and the blue ranger black. We can't have the black ranger being black. Everyone would lose their minds. Stick to how the movies are supposed to be and I bet the rating would be better.

Review title: The movie was not as bad as it sounds
Review_body: It saddens me how people can be so picky for a movie that's meant to be a REBOOT. The cgi looked great, the story behind each character was quite deep and relatable. Also, there were many clips that explains the story of why the power rangers are formed and why the villain is attacking the city. The movie was not nostalgic BECAUSE it's a reboot, it's meant to create nostalgia for the new generation of fans, not us 90s spandex fanboys. I'm no movie expert which is why I may be slightly on the optimistic side but give the movie a go, it won't hurt if you just try it out and not listen to the picky critics

Review title: Feeling obligated to write this after seeing all the BS reviews.
Review_body: I really didn't planned to write a review for this, but seeing this many bad reviews, with that much nonsense to justify it ? I mean, if you expect great storytelling, mature subjects and deep questions ; first you've probably never watched a single Power Ranger episode or never liked it and second, why did you expect all that from an adaptation of one of the cheesiest series ever made ? This movie isn't REALLY good, for sure, but I genuinely had fun watching it. The characters are fun, almost equally developed over the movie, and the fight scenes (at the end, halas) were cool too ! It's a shame there isn't more fights, yeah, but that does NOT justify a 2/10 review if you knew what you were going to watch. If you've watched Power Rangers as a series, and enjoyed it, you will enjoy this movie for what it is ; a really fun adaptation. I hope this gets a sequel. Had a great time.

This movie has high production standards, by far the best production standards for anything Power Rangers or Super Sentai ever. Secondly, everyone on screen does a great job with their characters. The kids in the movie are fantastic actors who will have many big projects in the future.There are scenes that are intended for teens rather than kids, but if you can get over that and just enjoy the movie, you will be pleased. They are looking for a 15-35 demographic here.The main issue is that there is a lack of memorable scenes and the movie needed more action spots. Maybe even dug a little deeper into the mythology behind the Power Rangers. Explain why they exist and who the dangerous people in this world is.I believe the studio and producers were thinking that this would be an origin story and there would be many movies. But it did not do that well at the box office. New ideas are needed, maybe even doing a little more over the top stuff from the TV series. Something is missing here, which is why it got a 7 out of 10 for me. There's so many places that future movies can get to, but not sure if we will get sequels.

I don't get it. why people are giving this movie so much hate? True. This movie peeks into some controversial topics and issues. True. This movie has some unnecessary cheesy moments and dumb stuff.And True. Most people are sitting high on their ****ing pedestals and cannot appreciate a nice movie that do justice to the original source material and give it in a fresh new way.So, to all the so called "Reviewers" with a bad attitude, I say **** You but have a nice day.and to the rest I say, Go watch it have a few laughs and have a Great day!

**CAUTION: CONTAINS SOME SPOILERS** The movie definitely surpassed my expectations. When the trailer was first released, I thought about going to see it but was not truly interested. When it was released to the public, I bought it and was surprised to like it as much as I did. Though it won't be up for any awards, it was enjoyable and fun to watch.If you want to see it because you were a fan of the old television show, be prepared for disappointment. This movie was not made to appeal to the previous generations. It has elements of nostalgia, but if you go into it expecting what you watched as a kid, you will not like this movie.KEEP IN MIND PEOPLE that this movie is PG-13, so if you have KIDS, you might want to look out for cussing, sexual innuendos, rebellious behavior, and scenes that IMPLY things of a sexual nature. It's a film about teenagers, so what more could be expected? Tapping into the teenage world, it was refreshing to see teenage drama play out in a way that is true to the real world.And the characters are truly everything people have been asking for and a major step in the right direction for the film industry. You have black, white, Asian, Indian, and Latino characters all sharing lead roles with one being apart of the LGBTQ+ community and another with Autism. And both aren't shoved into the background at any point. There is even dialogue in the movie referencing their different colored Power Ranger suits and their different ethnicities: "Five kids, five colors, five different colored kids!"Problems I had with the film include CGI not being the best at times and the characters taking quite a while to mesh together and become a team. You also don't get to see them in their armor until the ending of the movie, which I can understand they tried to build up for suspense but didn't work the way the crew wanted it to. The movie wasn't as action packed as you expect a superhero movie to be. While I liked the fact they incorporated the ranger colors into the costume design, it seemed to me like they tried to overcompensate for the bland armor of the TV show by creating something shiny and new, but that just fell flat in my opinion. They just looked awkward to me in the scenes where they finally had morphed. WOULD RECOMMEND.Despite some points, this movie is overall a great watch. The ending does hold a cliffhanger with the role of the green ranger in the next film, but with how this film did in theaters, I would say do not watch after the credits unless you want to be taunted with the idea of a movie that may not be created. Holding out for a sequel.

It is a good movie with great special effects. Very good acting and well written. The movie starts off good with character development and ends great with fight seen. Was one of my favorite shows as a kid and was very happy with this movie. It is a must see for previous fans and new ones.

Review title: Original series compacted into a solid movie
Review_body: The original series was of it's time, cheap but effective costumes and to look back at it today would make you wonder.. what was even going on. However, as a kid who grew up in that exact time it was fantastic. And to see a series such as Power Rangers being revisited and updated to the current time it makes sense for it to be a bit darker, grittier and happily with a much larger budget and special effects team. To understand the movie you would at least have to be familiar with the original series to a sampling extent. Sure in places it was very dark and some of the camera angles may want to be revised for any sequels. Perhaps less forced product placement but that's easily forgiven in comparison to Jurassic World.

I don't understand what all the bad reviews are on this movie. I overall thought this was a great movie. It has everything to make it a good movie, humor action and true friendship. Power rangers has been a movie that everyone has tried to remake, as for this remake I feel as if its worth watching. You can have your own opinion, but I loved it and think they did a great job on this.

As a fan of the series since day one, I am excited that we got a power rangers movie its a reboot not a remake so two different things, overall these cast did amazing job, those who talk negative about the movie or series don't listen to them because they never give anything a chance, instead they should worrying about these marvel dc films. but overall its fun film with lots of Easter eggs from all the seasons. i will watch this over again. and will get a sequel. its always great to relive the moment you watch the series and always give new members a warm welcome. plus I who loves wearing these suits, so don't listen to critics and or fake fans or so cool people who complain a lot. see if you self if you like then you like it. watch as a open minded person who love the series from both Japaneses and American version,

This review contains SPOILERS!!!! This review contains SPOILERS!!!! We loved the movie. But I personally don't see where they spent the $100,000,000. Did they pay Cranston $25,000,000.?????? 3/4 of the movie was pretty normal except the final act where all the majority of the CGI went.The movie was awesome. Most people have bad reviews on it, but I still think it was time well spent.Here comes the spoilers.When Rita had all the power rangers captured. She should have killed all of them, instead of just the blue ranger (even though he lived.) This was a classic villain mistake.I didn't have any problems with the cast. Elizabeth Banks did a great job as Rita.Why does people think the blue ranger was autistic? I think he was just a regular nerd. When he was in the cafeteria scene talking about knocking out the bully, Billy sounded completely normal.

This was one of the best origins stories I have seen. It gives you insight to the characters and great action scenes. Instead of just having them become power rangers right away, it gave the kids some backstory. I related the characters in many ways, which made me enjoy the movie even more. The special effects were awesome, acting was solid, and the plot made perfect sense. Do not listen to snobby critics. If you like fun action movies, you'll enjoy this.

I read a lot of reviews that think this movie is trash lmao. What do people expect game of thrones? A stupid nostalgic kids movie? I was never a fan of the TV show. A lot of people I know we're though and they liked he movie. I don't think there is enough time in a movie to have the character development you get while playing a 60 hour rpg. Especially when you have to try and simultaneously make all the characters from multiple seasons of a TV show and multiple movies accessible to a new crowd and not make it too campy while adding enough comedy to keep it fun for younger people. I wish there was another hour to allow more backstory but in the end their teenagers. How many teens do you know that have a life story that's super interesting? The movie did a good job introducing the Rangers, although some get a better treatment than others. The cast is great. The effects are adequate. The end made me want another one right away. It was a fun movie. I want to see a well oiled ranger team kick some butt in the next one.

Is it a good movie ? No. Will you enjoy it ? yeah. If you don't know anything about the power rangers you won't enjoy it much. But every 90's kid will enjoy some morphing time. Exactly as cliché and cheesy you want it to be. You wont be disappointed if you are looking for a movie which is like a first episode to a power rangers season

Apparently none of you remember the original series or the reboot shows following being just as "cheesy" as some of you say. I'm a 80s baby that grew up watching this show and now have babies of my own who watch the "Original" power rangers as well as the reboot shows. All of these shows have that cheesy feel to it but it's what made us all love it and still do. You all are just hating so bad on this movie because these kids don't fit your expectations of what a power ranger should be from the beginning. The directors are trying to tell a different story, yes in the beginning these kids did some bad things & made bad choices. But they start to realize what it is become a true power ranger. Who go from selfish teenage misfits to teenage kids who care about the world and saving their home and the planet. And the sexuality you all are crying about don't remember the original movie where Kimberly practically threw herself at Jason every chance she got & then there was Dulcea who was an almost half naked woman. Yet I see no one pointy that out. Oh that's right its because this is 2017 & a little sexual jokes is like someone just walked around fully naked down the road. So those that "followed" the show from the beginning as well as the remakes, should be maybe re watch those movies and shows & realize that this movie is not as bad as you all make it seem.
I hated it. Another movie of young rebels that after a questionable reason, they are the only hope.

Review title: Good Job on Reboot! Watch it.
Review_body: Warning: Spoilers! First off, I can remember when the very first episode of Power Rangers came on. I grew up with the original and following versions of Power Rangers. I loved it as did most kids I grew up with. I'll be honest; I did not want to watch the movie. Or maybe I'd watch it once it casually came out on Netflix or Hulu. However, my younger brother talked me into watching it and I wasn't disappointed. It felt like the original Power Rangers movie but they said, let's take out all the child like moments and reinsert young adult moments/reactions into, which made sense to me. After all, the power rangers where in high school. Is it a safe clean kid's movie? No, it isn't. But it made it better. Changes to the Franchise.I was on the fence about Alpha-5. He looked awkward to me. The voice didn't work for me either. I guess I was still expecting to see and hear the original Alpha-5. They could have at least left him the same. However, Zordon and Rita, being former rangers, was great. I don't remember any backstory, for them in the original show. Both were more relatable. Even though the original Rita was iconic, with her annoying voice and elaborate costume, the new Rita nailed it. Elizabeth Banks version was fantastic; completely unrecognizable. For once, it seemed Rita was in control and a total bad a**. Zordon to me, took a little time to warm up to. I did. I love how they explained why he is stuck inside the crystals and how he didn't have total faith in the new team. The rangers also had their backstory told which I thought was great. I didn't realize that until this movie; we really had not been told their story. The costumes in all the promotional material looked like crap. They honestly reminded me of the CGI effects from the original Power Rangers movie. Way too shiny! However, in the movie, they looked great. No complaints. The Zords felt like the old Zords. Still great! Overall, I think this reboot did a great job! They even snuck in the original Power Ranges theme song, lightning bolt and even set up Rita to live in outer space in the next movie; which I hope they make! Now, how anyone can give this movie one or two stars, I'm not sure. Unless they were paid to do so. I'll give this nine stars because they kept intact the original, iconic material, while making it more grown up which is essentially all any Power Ranger fan wanted. Just take the cheesy-ness out of SABANS Power Rangers and make it more real. Watch it and enjoy the movie for what it is.

This movie was garbage. It was boring from start to end. It just kept dragging on and on and on and finally morphine time and it was also a huge let down. What was it 2 hour movie? And small BORING battle at the end. I mean this movie had no fire, no energy, no nothing. BORING! I liked the Power Rangers series as a kid, but this was nothing compared to that. Suits were pretty cool and droids, but you hardly even see them. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!!

Review title: I mean, come on, it is Power Rangers.
Review_body: I thought it was pretty good. Let's be real, Power Rangers was impossibly cheesy and hard to watch in its original form. So you can't expect this to be Oscar worthy. I liked the background. Loved the Billy character and inclusion of someone on the spectrum. I thought Elizabeth Banks, who I LOVE, wasn't as awesome in this as she was in say her Effie Trinket performance, but she was no more cheesy than the original character in this role from the original movies. I do think it took a little long to get to the actual morphing suit wearing part. Additionally, I think for a kid movie, it could have done without the cursing. You have to know kids are going to watch it. Other than that, it was entertaining enough to watch with family on a Saturday night. My kids liked it. Overall, it was entertaining in a "hey let's watch a movie that is light in thought and entertaining in a predictable but still pretty good for a laid back night" kind of way.

Review title: I cant believe i cry while watching a power ranger movie
Review_body: I have a really low expectation when I came to watch this movie.. I thought it was going to be awful but it's actually pretty good.the characters back story was so much worth exploring in a sequel. the acting was pretty solid. it may not have a good action sequence but the story was pretty much spot on. and that one part when one of the Rangers died was pretty well done. I am a grown man but the atmosphere of that one scene really make me cry. this movie is worth your time and definitely worth your money.

Review title: What is up with the low rating?
Review_body: I went to see this movie on my 16th birthday, and, unfortunately, movie going isn't exactly an easy thing to obtain where I am from. My brother, who doesn't like movies, went with me only because this was Power Rangers, a franchise we both love. I get it, the Krispy Kreme thing is ridiculous, but both of kept laughing the entire way through. We both loved this movie, definitely my favorite movie of the year behind Spider-man Homecoming. It deserves something like a 7 or so.

Review title: Best remake ever, must see, hope to see part 2!!!!!!
Review_body: All of you dumb ass people don't know a good remake if it slaped you in the face and took your lunch money, i grew up with the old school, this movie is better than the old, better graphics, better martial arts, better suits, goldar has a better concept, than a gold monkey that got his ass kicked, the story line is different, i like it more that they did miner changes, same old school concept with new 2017 upgrade, really cool, ya dumb asses need to give prop to the guy that made this film..... And i hope to the good of all mankind they make sequel's( more than 1)... I like the old, love the new even more!!! Dumb ass negative people's

Review title: Do not let your children watch this
Review_body: First off, I consider myself a pretty easy going young parent. I'm 27 and while I try to keep my child innocent I'm far from living under a rock. OK so, my son recently turned 6 and has taken an interest in the power rangers. I was so excited to share something from my childhood and had high hopes for this movie. Unfortunately, this movie is absolute garbage. It's clear that Hollywood is trying to poison the minds of our children (surprise surprise, with all their vile pedophilia coming to the forefront). The first scene was literally a joke about jerking off a bull. It added nothing to the movie, tied into nothing else in the movie, but they just had to include that perverted joke. There were many sexual references through the movie, foul language, and the characters were horrible role models. Nothing like the power rangers when I was a kid. If that wasn't bad enough the movie is SO BORING! It dragged on for nearly 2 hours then ended with a weak fighting scene. Luckily my son lost interest within the first 15 minutes so he didn't catch all the filth in this movie.Save your self money and 2 hours of your life that you can never get back and avoid this lousy movie.

Acting is a little overdone, but then again so was the original. As a person who grew up with the show when it first aired, this rendition is meant to be another genesis story. Provide a little more background and bring it up to today's technological specs. While I think it tried too hard and perhaps did try to take itself a bit too seriously, if you come in with an open mind about it, you'll be somewhat surprised and may find that you enjoy it. I found that the camera angles and cinematography was okay, but it had moments where it felt very cheesy. If they could have picked up a really good director for action / sci-first (eg Whedon), we could have had a really excellent and fun movie. Alas, it falls slightly short of good. If you're looking for a bit of a campy movie with some good cheese factor, check it out. Otherwise, perhaps pass this one up.

Review title: Much better than I anticipated, worth a watch, don't expect to be blown away.
Review_body:
While stumbling through Netflix I saw this film advertised and was surprised to see a new full feature Power Ranger film had been released. I decided to give it a go and was honestly very pleasantly surprised.Power Rangers was never my favorite show as a child. I was always more into Transformers and Dragonball Z; they were always darker, the fight scenes 
were more intense and less ridiculous than a group of teenagers in silly looking colored coded suits; like a selection of angry crayons fighting against disabled monsters. Being born in 1990, alot of my friends would watch it when I went to their house though so I still feel like it's not only part of my childhood but also something I remember fondly on the whole (although I definitely don't have the same level of fandom some people writing reviews here seem too). The action is good, the Zoids are pretty amazing and I have to agree with another reviewer I actually preferred them to the Micheal Bay Transformers. They are clean and simple, not overly complicated and difficult to distinguish making the fight scenes in them clearer and easier to watch. The Megazoid transformation is great and I thought the level of CGI was quite impressive throughout but not mind blowing. But what made the film great to me was the general moral code of the Power Rangers. It was just... nice. Perhaps this narrative is slightly cliche now, it's a fairly standard action film but I felt it sincere. Troubled kids meet each other by chance/fate/destiny and would sincerely die for each other only after a few days of knowing one another. They love each other and want to do right by each other as friends and as people. They genuinely do not hesitate* to take up the mantle as save others lives like heroes. I think that is admirable, and a great role model for children to look up. The Rangers are also quite identifiable as people, with real teenage troubles that cover a wide spectrum that kids and teens will relate too. The whole lesbian thing with Trini (Yellow Ranger) was very briefly delved into and although Billy (Blue ranger) didn't feel autistic if I'm honest he was still one of the best characters, outside of Alpha.I would give this movie a shot. Try not to be crazy disappointing when you realise this is not a nostalgia trip but more of a reboot and re imagining. There is one nice scene with the power rangers theme that made me smile but outside of that, I don't think you'll get a warm fuzzy buzz from remembering and comparing it to the original Power Rangers. Which is a good thing because the original Power Rangers is terrible and a cheese fest. Enjoy it for what it is; a pretty good action movie for teens, with a feel good message about teamwork, friendship, self-love, personal healing and the power of cooperation.
* Well slightly at first, but they have alot to digest and I'm unsure if I would trust a giant talking head and a strange but very good humored robot. Why they know English is beyond me. But they build robot dinosaurs so maybe instantly picking a language and knowing the personal details of peoples lives is childsplay.

All right, I have seen Power Rangers: Ninja Steel and Power Rangers: Dino Charge and they both have the same effect on me. This movie is even worse! Mighty Morphin Power Rangers is okay.I can tell everyone 3 THINGS. 1.) The Power Rangers always win the wars and battles. 2.) The Megazords look like they are toys and the background are so dumb. 3.) They say things when they want to do a move (watch Sumrai, Ninja Steel, and Dino Charge if you want to see).Never watch Power Rangers. Watch Avengers or Marvel movies.This movie sucks.
A Brilliant honor to the TV show adding a refresh to the present day.
I'm not sure if this was the best transformer movie or the worst Krispy Kreme commercial I've ever seen. As a PR fan I felt that I had to watch it eventual. So I finally did.

Loved it! Saw the previews in 2017, and thought it would suck. Took me a year and now I regret not watching it sooner! This makes me remember my childhood! I loved Power Rangers! I had all the action figures and a Power Rangers sleeping bag. Hopefully there will be more. Also hope they make queen sized Power Rangers comforter, because I want one!
Cringy lines of dialogue, mediocre acting, good special effects. I would avoid this movie and spare yourself 2 hours of your time for another movie.

I grew up watching Power Rangers as a little girl and loved it. I am now 18 years old. And the Power Rangers have taken a more mature, modern and darker tone. Which is great. The target audience for this film is the kids who watched it when they were younger, who are now ADULTS. It is literally targeted to all of us who are between 16-21 years old. To make it more appealing they had to make it more mature. I also thought the cast was great and I loved the diversity of the rangers themselves. Plus there was a great cameo. I really hope they decide to make a second one as the talent from every actor in this movie was superb. Overall, I thought it was a brilliant remake of Power Rangers. And I also dont feel bad for watching "a kid's movie" bc its truly targeted for the kids who watched it when they were little. The new generation of Rangers are way more badass than the original and everything is insanely realistic. Great film. 10 out of 10 would recommend.

First scene is epic. Its just epic onwards. They took the formula and made it. Actually made a proper film with the exact formula that lots of us watched as kids, this is far greater than any of the other power ranger movies, it has great cast, feel good quality, amazing effects. The only way this would get a bad review is if you dont know the source material and you expected this to be a modern scifi war film. Its not and its epic. All the characters are great, somewhat more modern, they love each other and I love them. Cant wait for the next one. Im going to tell everyone to watch this. It is absolutely great. Aye aye aye Zordon!
